We and you are driven to build bridges, both with our colleagues and with our users, we are interested in someone who can work well with a team and but also drive work forward on your own.

 **What you will do;**

* Understand (B2B) telecom concepts both high level and down in details. Help stakeholders in analysing the end-to-end experience but also be able to zoom in on details and create tangible solutions to real problems.
* Lead and facilitate variety of design thinking/ ideation workshops with multidisciplinary teams.
* Use storytelling effectively to communicate user insights, opportunity areas, and concept designs to different audiences.
* Run studies and analyse research data (that comes from interviews, various data sources, desk research, and co-creation workshops) to identify key insights and translate them into opportunities.
* Develop design content and specifications within a multidisciplinary team to build an understanding of the intended solutions both with the Network area and the other Business areas.
* Working with and challenge technical experts, UX designers, developers, product owners, system engineers, and visual designers to solve the right problems and build the right user experience. Never be afraid of asking questions and challenge status quo.
* Explore design trends, best practices, and discover how they can be applied to Ericsson products and services.
* Participate actively in the Design and User Experience unit's business development efforts by supporting managers to prepare thoughtful proposals and project approaches.

 **Skills you bring;**

* Expert in Human-Centered & Service Design You know how to create meaningful, user-driven experiences.
* You excel at building relationships and guiding cross-functional teams to success.
* Several years of experience, and you’ve mastered the art of design execution and consulting in diverse environments.
* Degree (bachelor's or higher) in Interaction Design, Service Design, Human Computer Interaction, Human Computer Interaction, UX Design, or related field.
* Ability to work independently in complex areas.
* Excellent project management skills and an ability to manage multiple tasks consistently in a changing business environment.
* Effective writing and verbal communication skills corporate language is English
* Have experience with a variety of design software including FigJam, Figma, Adobe and Microsoft 365

 **We would like to see your portfolio of design projects and your work process - to which you have made a significant contribution.**

**What happens once you apply?**


Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.


We encourage you to consider applying to jobs where you might not meet all the criteria. We recognize that we all have transferrable skills, and we can support you with the skills that you need to develop.


Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we champion it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. learn more.

**Primary country and city:** [[Sweden]] || [[Stockholm]]

**Primary Recruiter:** [[Anitha Pulluru]]

**Hiring Manager:** [[Hans- Ulrik Grunth]]
company_description: Do you want to be part of shaping the future? From making connectivity more accessible to the latest IoT solutions, you have an opportunity to be where it begins.

title: Digital Designer
description:
**Digital Designer** 




  




**About Napper** 


 Napper is a fast-growing startup building AI-powered digital experiences to improve child sleep and strengthen the bond between parent and child. The Napper app has been used by more than one million parents around the world and has more than 20,000 five-star reviews. The app is frequently featured on the App Store as an Editors’ Choice app, and has been App of the Day in most European countries.
 





 Our vision is ambitious; crafting and launching AAA-products that serve as essential digital partners for parents in their everyday life. Leveraging the latest technology combined with emphatic, human-centered design, we are scaling to become a household name for all families, everywhere. Our mission is to make sure each parent goes to bed at night feeling like the best parent in the world.
 





 We are backed by some of Sweden’s most prominent angel investors and two international top-tier VC firms. That being said, we are also cash flow positive.
 




  




**How we work** 


 We are a tight group of talented (arguably), fun (subjectively) and creative (definitively) people pushing the boundaries of product and business development. We are ambitious, but more importantly curious. We ask questions. We try things. We ideate and iterate. And sometimes, we even argue. Because we
 
*feel* 

 for the things we build.
 




 But most of all, we support each other. We laugh a lot. And we strive to make sure every person is really looking forward to coming into the office, every day. However, we also value freedom highly, and will cater to your needs whenever you need work to be flexible.
 



  




**What we look for** 


 You are a driven digital designer who is excited to be part of our journey scaling Napper. You are a creative adventurer and not afraid of new challenges. You are looking for a job where you can advance your career fast and get well compensated for the hard work you put in. You love working as a team while having a good sense of responsibility and independence, and find joy in creating outstanding user experiences.
 





 Our philosophy is to hire selectively and invest heavily in the people who work with us. If you become one of us - we’ll go above and beyond to make sure you find your work meaningful, inspiring, and stimulating, and feel fully supported by both your peers and superiors. We will evaluate your performance quarterly and re-negotiate your salary twice a year.
 




  




**What you will be doing** 


 You will be part of Nappers' Creative Team. You will work hand in hand with the Creative Director and CEO to develop the brand and design system. Day to day, you will create both UX/UI app design and support other teams with assets for social media, ads, web and more.
 




  




**Requirements** 
* Portfolio containing multiple examples of your digital designs
* 2-4 years of experience in digital design
* Relevant education in design
* Team player who can work independently and proactively
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills
* Working at the office in Slussen, Stockholm



  




**Nice to have** 
* Experience in app design
* Experience in working in Figma
* Animation skills

title: UX/UI-designer ─ digitala system
description:
*Dags för en ny utmaning? Är du duktig på design för digitala system? Vill du bidra med hantverk, sakkunnighet, kreativitet och struktur? Välkommen då till vårt designer-team på Euro Accident!*
 Försäkringar och hälsa är en vinnande kombination! Genom tidiga insatser, samarbete med kompetenta partners och smarta digitala tjänster har vi på Euro Accident fått saker att hända. Med vårt erbjudande har försäkring gått från att bara vara ekonomisk ersättning till att bidra till livskvalitet och Hållbara medarbetare. Idag har nästan en halv miljon människor trygghet genom oss. Vi är stolta över våra nöjda kunder, vårt goda rykte och den insats vi gör för samhället. Nu avancerar vi för att kunna hjälpa ännu fler och söker dig som vill vara med på vår fortsatta framgångsresa.
   

  

**Om rollen**
 Som UX/UI-designer hos oss kommer du att skapa logisk och tydlig informationsstruktur och hjälpsamma interaktioner för att våra användare ska få en god upplevelse av vår webb, mobilappar, intranät och övriga digitala system.
   

  

 Du kommer att:
   

  

* Samarbeta i tvärfunktionella agila team och projektgrupper med Azure DevOps som nav. Tillsammans översätter ni behov och krav till lösningar. I arbetet ingår test av designen för att säkerställa funktionalitet och varumärkesöverstämmelse.
* Använda Figma för att designa och presentera allt från övergripande koncept i skisser och prototyper till pixelperfekta användargränssnitt med vårt designsystem som grund. Du kan utgå från behovsprofiler och empatikartor för att skapa lösningar och har förmågan att presentera designen i form av användarresor.
* Designa nya användargränssnitt för olika enheter och system men också utvärdera och bidra till förbättringar av existerande lösningar.
* Samverka med designteamet kring lösningar för att säkerställa en användbar och tillgänglig upplevelse och bidra till utvecklingen av vårt designsystem.
* Vid tillfällen, vara behjälplig där det behövs genom att exempelvis skapa innehållsdesign för våra kanaler, bearbeta foton, skapa ikoner eller förhöja en powerpointpresentation.


 Du välkomnas till vårt härliga kommunikationsteam med 11 kollegor i Stockholm. Du blir en del av ett sammansvetsat gäng där samarbete och ett snällt förhållningssätt präglar gemenskapen. Att hjälpa varandra och dela kunskap är en självklar del av vardagen. För oss är det lika viktigt att nå goda resultat tillsammans som det är att ha kul på jobbet!
   

  

 Kommunikationsavdelningen ingår i stödfunktionen Product & brand och har som avdelning det övergripande ansvaret för företagets kommunikation, både externt och internt, att på kort sikt stötta alla affärsområden och stödfunktioner med kommunikativt material och på lång sikt bygga varumärkeskännedom. Andra ansvarsområden är: säkerställa att varumärkesnära och användarvänlig design används på våra digitala plattformar, redaktionellt- och förvaltningsansvar av externwebb och intranät (Mitt EA) samt att skapa förutsättningar för en väl fungerande internkommunikation.
   

  

**Vem är du**
 För att lyckas i rollen som UX/UI-designer har du en kandidatexamen i interaktionsdesign, visuell design eller motsvarande kunskaper och några års erfarenhet av en liknande roll där du arbetat med agil utveckling i nära samarbete med utvecklare. Du har erfarenhet av att arbeta inom hela designprocessen, från problemformulering till lanserad lösning och sedan i vidare förvaltning. Ibland arbetar du i hela processen, ofta med detaljer i en delprocess. Du har goda kunskaper i Figma och talar/skriver obehindrat på både svenska och engelska. Det är också viktigt att du har kunskap om och vill ta ansvar för att vi lever upp till tillgänglighetsrekommendationer i våra lösningar (till exempel från WCAG).
   

  

 Det är meriterande om du:
   

  

* Har kunskap i Photoshop, Illustrator, Indesign och erfarenhet av grafisk design samt kunskap om grundläggande UX-copy.
* Har erfarenhet av kvalitativ och kvantitativ research som användartester och dataanalys.
* Har erfarenhet av att planera och leda projekt.
* Har goda kunskaper om Sitevision.


 Som person trivs du bäst i samarbete med andra där du också får möjlighet till långvarigt relationsbyggande med utvecklingsteamet och andra medarbetare. Du är en utpräglad problemlösare med god kommunikativ förmåga att anpassa ditt budskap efter mottagaren. Du är van vid att argumentera för dina designbeslut och lösningar samt dokumenterar och presenterar dem på ett tydligt sätt.
   

  

 Med omtanke, handlingskraft och nytänkande är du med och gör vardagen lite bättre för varje initiativ. Du ser till helheten, tar ansvar och bidrar till gemenskapen.
   

  

 På Euro Accident är det vi medarbetare som bygger framgång. Personliga egenskaper och förmågor är alltid en viktig komponent när vi söker nya medarbetare.
   

  

**Vad vi erbjuder dig**
 När vi bidrar till en trygg och frisk värld börjar vi på våra egna kontor. Vi vill att du ska ha en sund balans mellan arbete och privatliv och vi värnar om arbetsglädjen och vår unika kultur där omtanke, handlingskraft och nytänkande är våra ledord i vardagen. Utöver förmånlig tjänstepension och ett flexibelt arbetsliv, innehåller vårt omfattande förmånspaket bland annat sjuk- och sjukvårdsförsäkring, samtalsstöd, ett generöst friskvårdsbidrag, möjlighet till träning och massage på arbetstid och gemensam frukost varje dag samt andra sociala aktiviteter i sann EA-spirit!
   

  

 Du välkomnas till vårt fina nyrenoverade kontor vid Mörby C. Start enligt överenskommelse. Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning på heltid. Vi tillämpar provanställning på sex månader.
   

  

**Välkommen med din ansökan**
 Om du har frågor om tjänsten är du välkommen att kontakta rekryterande chef enligt kontaktuppgifter nedan. Urval sker löpande, så vänta inte med din ansökan. Vi planerar att genomföra första intervjuer efter årsskiftet v2−3 2025.
   

  

 För en mer rättvis och objektiv urvalsprocess använder vi arbetspsykologiska tester tidigt i processen och ber dig att svara på våra urvalsfrågor istället för att bifoga ett personligt brev.
   

  

 Som en del av vår rekryteringsprocess genomför vi bakgrundskontroller på slutkandidater innan anställningsbeslut.
   

  

*Vänligen notera att vi inte tar emot ansökningar via mejl med anledning av GDPR.*
**Om Euro Accident** 
 Euro Accident är ett svenskt livförsäkringsbolag med verksamhet på marknaderna i Sverige, Norge och Danmark. Företaget grundades 1996 och har i dag över 2,4 miljarder svenska kronor i årlig premievolym och närmare 500 medarbetare. Vi är specialister på risk-, grupp- och sjukvårdsförsäkringar och att förhindra eller åtgärda långa sjukskrivningar med insatser inom våra försäkringar. Våra kunder är företag och organisationer som tecknar våra olika försäkringar för sina medarbetare och medlemmar genom försäkringsförmedlare och partners. Vårt huvudkontor ligger i Stockholm. En del av vår it-verksamhet finns även på kontoret i Belgrad. I Göteborg, Köpenhamn, Malmö, Oslo, Växjö och Örnsköldsvik finns lokala kontor för administration, försäljning och kundservice för respektive marknad. Tillsammans skapar vi Hållbara medarbetare

title: Head of Product & UX
description:
**Oneflow is a rapidly growing tech scale-up located in the heart of Stockholm. We have created a platform that automates the entire contract process from start to finish, all in one place. Turning clunky, static contracts into customer-oriented, digital contracts that feel like magic.** 




  





 As Head of Product & UX, you’ll oversee the strategy, development, and execution of Oneflow’s product and user experience efforts. You’ll lead and grow a talented team of Product Managers and UX Designers, ensuring they work together seamlessly to create products that deliver real value to our customers and the business. Reporting to the Chief Product Officer, you’ll collaborate across the organisation with engineering, marketing, sales, and customer success to align efforts with our product vision and strategy.
 



  





**Here’s how you’ll make an impact:** 




  




* You’ll mentor and guide a multidisciplinary team of Product Managers and UX Designers, empowering them to deliver innovative, user-centred solutions that drive growth and customer satisfaction.
* You’ll champion both product discovery and delivery, balancing fast-paced execution with user insights, continuous discovery, and research-driven decision-making.
* You’ll ensure our product and UX strategies align with customer needs and business goals.
* You’ll foster seamless collaboration between PMs, UX designers, engineers, and other stakeholders, building a shared understanding of priorities and ensuring smooth operations.
* You’ll refine and implement our Product Operating Model while ensuring product growth and driving key metrics across acquisition, retention and monetisation.
* You’ll drive the evolution of our design system and UX principles, ensuring we deliver a cohesive, delightful experience across the user journey.



 Success in this role means delivering products that are intuitive, valuable, and actively adopted by users, while fostering a collaborative and high-performing team culture.
 



  





**Who you are** 




  





 You’re a passionate leader who thrives at the intersection of product strategy and user experience. With deep expertise in product development and design, you know how to create meaningful collaboration between UX and PM teams, balancing customer needs with business priorities. You’re as comfortable coaching your team as you are engaging directly with customers or diving into strategic decisions. You believe that great products are born from strong teamwork, user insights, and data-driven decisions. Also:
 



  




* You inspire and motivate teams to think big while keeping a keen eye on the tactical steps needed to achieve results.
* You thrive on understanding user needs and championing them in product and UX strategies.
* You excel at building relationships across teams, fostering trust and alignment between Product, UX, Design, Engineering, and beyond.
* You’re skilled at connecting data-driven insights with creative problem-solving to drive impactful decisions.
* You understand the power of UX and design to differentiate a product and ensure exceptional customer experiences.



  





**Your background** 




  




* 3+ years of leadership experience in SaaS Product Management and/or UX design.
* Hands-on experience with B2B SaaS products, preferably with exposure to both growth motions (PLG, PLS) and customer success-driven models.
* A strong grasp of product discovery and delivery methodologies, including design thinking, user research, and data analysis.
* A track record of coaching teams to achieve strategic goals and personal growth.
* Experience with a Product Operating Model and advocating for UX principles across an organisation.
* A collaborative, empathetic leadership style that values transparency and trust.



  





**Come work with us** 




  





 We value gender equality and diversity in organisation, so we strive for a team that reflects the diversity in today's society. At Oneflow we currently have 33 nationalities and are proud of an extremely diverse workplace. Our recruitment is based on competence.
 



  





 The recruitment process begins with an interview with Aleksandra from the Talent Acquisition team. Next, you will complete a personality and logic test, followed by a meeting with Nikko, the hiring manager. Finally, you will prepare for an assignment and participate in a case interview.
 



  





**We can’t wait to meet you! 🎉** 




  





 Visit our website for more information about our product and Oneflow. Visit our blog for more information about our culture and future colleagues. 💜

title: Senior UX Researcher
description:
**Job Description** 




 We are now looking for a talented and experienced Senior UX Researcher to join our global Group IT team. The Senior UX Researcher will be responsible for leading user research activities to inform the design of our products and services. This role requires an individual with a deep understanding of UX research methods and strong analytical skills. You will become a part of a team with colleagues from around the globe that together support our internal employees across all markets.
 



  





**About the team:** 




 Group IT is an internal Capgemini function that delivers a comprehensive portfolio of technology services to the entire Capgemini Group. We look after more than 360,000 employees in countries and continents across the world, around the clock. We work with a wide variety of business lines, each requiring specific IT solutions and support. With people from a diverse range of cultures, all collaborating to achieve a common set of goals.
 



 The global User Experience team’s mission is to make IT simple. We do this by focussing on the end-user with the aim of making their lives easier and more productive through outstanding UX and automation. We run monthly UX meetups for the whole company and host an annual conference.
 



  





**Your responsibilities include** 




 • Lead user research initiatives, including planning, executing, and analysing research studies to inform product design decisions.
 



 • Work with cross-functional teams to identify research needs and prioritize research initiatives based on product goals and objectives.
 



 • Develop research plans and methodologies, including user recruitment, study design, and data collection methods.
 



 • Conduct qualitative and quantitative research, including usability testing, surveys, interviews, and focus groups.
 



 • Oversee the research and development of our applications by establishing performance metrics and analytics. Generate actionable, data-driven insights to improve application performance and enhance user satisfaction.
 



 • Synthesize research findings into actionable insights that inform product design decisions and strategy.
 



 • Communicate research findings and insights to cross-functional teams, including product managers, designers, and developers.
 



 • Mentor and manage a team of UX researchers, providing guidance and support as needed.
 



  





**Qualifications** 




 • 5+ years of experience conducting user research in a UX design or product development environment.
 



 • Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Human-Computer Interaction, Psychology, or a related field.
 



 • Proven track record of leading successful UX research initiatives that have influenced product design decisions.
 



 • Expertise in a variety of research methodologies, including qualitative and quantitative research methods.
 



 • Experience with user research tools and software.
 



 • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
 



 • Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
 



 • Ability to work collaboratively with cross-functional teams.
 



  





 If you are passionate about UX research and have a strong track record of leading successful research initiatives, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity.

title: Senior Service Designer
description:
Join our Team
   

  

**About The Opportunity**
 We are seeking a Senior Service Designer to join our Business Area Networks (BNEW) UX team . This is an exciting opportunity to work with both hardware, software and processes in Ericsson products, collaborating with a dynamic team of 40 designers in industrial design, user research, UX, and service design. You will play a key role in shaping the end-to-end experience for B2B telecom solutions, using human-centered design principles to create real, tangible impact. From leading design thinking workshops to analyzing user research, you will help solve complex problems and drive innovative solutions and studies alongside engineers, product owners, and UX experts.
   

  

 As Senior Service Designer at Ericsson, you have the chance to create a positive impact internally but most important externally. We and you are driven to build bridges, both with our colleagues and with our users, we are interested in someone who can work well with a team and but also drive work forward on your own.
   

  

**What you will do;**
* Understand (B2B) telecom concepts both high level and down in details. Help stakeholders in analysing the end-to-end experience but also be able to zoom in on details and create tangible solutions to real problems.
* Lead and facilitate variety of design thinking/ ideation workshops with multidisciplinary teams.
* Use storytelling effectively to communicate user insights, opportunity areas, and concept designs to different audiences.
* Run studies and analyse research data (that comes from interviews, various data sources, desk research, and co-creation workshops) to identify key insights and translate them into opportunities.
* Develop design content and specifications within a multidisciplinary team to build an understanding of the intended solutions both with the Network area and the other Business areas.
* Working with and challenge technical experts, UX designers, developers, product owners, system engineers, and visual designers to solve the right problems and build the right user experience. Never be afraid of asking questions and challenge status quo.
* Explore design trends, best practices, and discover how they can be applied to Ericsson products and services.
* Participate actively in the Design and User Experience unit's business development efforts by supporting managers to prepare thoughtful proposals and project approaches.


**Skills you bring;**
* Expert in Human-Centered & Service Design You know how to create meaningful, user-driven experiences.
* You excel at building relationships and guiding cross-functional teams to success.
* Several years of experience, and you’ve mastered the art of design execution and consulting in diverse environments.
* Degree (bachelor's or higher) in Interaction Design, Service Design, Human Computer Interaction, Human Computer Interaction, UX Design, or related field.
* Ability to work independently in complex areas.
* Excellent project management skills and an ability to manage multiple tasks consistently in a changing business environment.
* Effective writing and verbal communication skills corporate language is English
* Have experience with a variety of design software including FigJam, Figma, Adobe and Microsoft 365


**We would like to see your portfolio of design projects and your work process - to which you have made a significant contribution.**
**What happens once you apply?**
 Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.
   

  

 We encourage you to consider applying to jobs where you might not meet all the criteria. We recognize that we all have transferrable skills, and we can support you with the skills that you need to develop.
   

  

 Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we champion it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. learn more.
   

  

**Primary country and city:** 
 [[Sweden]] || [[Stockholm]]
   

  

**Primary Recruiter:** 
 [[Anitha Pulluru]]
   

  

**Hiring Manager:** 
 [[Hans- Ulrik Grunth]]
   

  

 ]]>

title: Director UX Research
description:
About the role
 



 We are seeking an experienced, passionate, and strategic UX Research Director to lead our UX research team and drive high-impact insights that define the future of our products and service development. The ideal candidate will be responsible for developing a strategic UX research vision, conducting impactful research initiatives, and driving actionable insights that enhance user satisfaction and business outcomes. This role is pivotal in shaping user experience strategies, enabling cross-functional alignment, and ensuring data-driven decision-making that prioritizes user needs. The UX Research Director will collaborate with Product, Design, Engineering, and other stakeholders to build scalable processes and deliver actionable research insights that elevate the quality of user experiences across the organization.
 



 This position is ideal for a seasoned research leader who thrives in a fast-paced, collaborative environment and is dedicated to building and scaling impactful research practices that align with both business objectives and user-centric goals.
 



  





**About the team:** 




 Group IT is an internal Capgemini function that delivers a comprehensive portfolio of technology services to the entire Capgemini Group. We look after more than 360,000 employees in countries and continents across the world, around the clock. We work with a wide variety of business lines, each requiring specific IT solutions and support. With people from a diverse range of cultures, all collaborating to achieve a common set of goals.
 



 The global User Experience team’s mission is to make IT simple. We do this by focussing on the end-user with the aim of making their lives easier and more productive through outstanding UX and automation. We run monthly UX meetups for the whole company and host an annual conference.
 



  





 Your responsibilities
 



**Vision & Strategy** 




 • Develop and execute a clear UX research strategy that aligns with company priorities, product roadmaps, and user needs.
 



 • Define and advocate for the role of UX research and service design in decision-making across the organization.
 



 • Establish and measure the impact of research efforts on product success, user satisfaction, and business growth.
 



**Team Leadership & Development** 




 • Lead, mentor, and grow a high-performing team of UX researchers with diverse expertise.
 



 • Foster a culture of collaboration, innovation, and continuous learning within the research team.
 



 • Build team capabilities to integrate service design and innovation into research practices.
 



**Research & Insights** 




 • Oversee the execution of end-to-end research projects, from planning to actionable insights.Utilize a range of qualitative and quantitative research methods, including usability testing, ethnographic studies, and surveys, and UAT (User Acceptance Testing).
 



 • Synthesize findings across multiple projects to deliver meaningful recommendations that inform long-term strategy.
 



**Measure Impact & Optimization** 




 • Establish metrics to measure and report on the impact of UX research on product success, user satisfaction, and business outcomes.
 



 • Continuously optimize research methodologies and tools to improve the quality and relevance of insights.
 



 • Advocate for the role of research in addressing user pain points and enabling seamless service design across touchpoints.
 



**Cross-Functional Collaboration** 




 • Implement scalable research processes, tools, and templates to streamline workflows and ensure consistency.
 



 • Stay current with industry trends, emerging research methods, and tools to maintain a cutting-edge approach.
 



 • Measure and report the impact of UX research on user satisfaction and business outcomes.
 



**Process Optimization** 




 • Establish and maintain scalable research processes, workflows, and deliverables.
 



 • Develop templates and frameworks to streamline research outputs and ensure consistency in quality.
 



**Design Systems & Tools** 




 • Oversee the integration of research insights into design systems to support consistency and scalability across all products.
 



 Qualifications
 



**Experience** 




 • 8+ years of experience in UX research with a proven track record of conducting impactful research and driving actionable insights, with at least 3-5 years in a leadership role and other managers, with a focus on mentoring and fostering talent.
 



 • Proven track record of leading complex, large-scale research projects from conception to execution and impact measurement.
 



**Expertise in Research & Design** 




 • Strong understanding of service design principles and research methodologies, including usability testing, ethnographic studies, and A/B testing.
 



 • Experience conducting and overseeing UAT processes and integrating user feedback into product iterations.
 



**Leadership & Communication Skills** 




 • Exceptional leadership, mentorship, and interpersonal skills.
 



 • Proven ability to navigate ambiguity and provide data-backed recommendationsinfluence stakeholders, and present complex research findings to diverse audiences effectively.
 



**Analytical & Problem-Solving Skills** 




 • Expertise in using analytics and research metrics to measure and optimize the user experience.
 



 • Innovative mindset and solutions-oriented approach to design challenges.
 



**Education** 




 • Advanced degree in Human-Computer Interaction, Psychology, Design, Anthropology, or a related field; a Ph.D. is a plus.

title: Business Analyst within eHealth
description:
Cambio is one of the Nordics' leading suppliers in e-health with a comprehensive offering for the entire health and care chain. Our e-health solutions support healthcare professionals in their daily work and offer patients safer and more easily accessible care. We are proud to be an important part of Swedish health and social care. We are growing continuously and now have about 1000 employees in several countries.
   

  

**The position**
 As a Business Analyst, you will be a part of an agile development team including developers, testers, architects, product owner and other business analysts. You will together with a solution team investigate and analyze needs, detail requirements, and design solutions for software used in critical care in the Nordic countries. You are an important link between the developers and the customer, with the mission to understand the needs of our end users and translate them into a way that enables the technical teams to build solutions. You often get to follow an initiative all the way from pre-study to development and implementation at the customer's premises. As part of our team, you will do meaningful work where you help to improve and digitize healthcare processes.
   

  

 We are currently looking for Business Analysts who will be working with one of our products used as decision support in the most vulnerable part of the hospitals. You will be working with creating mostly functional requirements but may also need to support non-functional requirements.
   

  

 At Cambio, we encourage taking initiatives that contribute to the development of the company and ourselves. For us, it is important that you should have the opportunity to grow, both as a person and as an employee. Our culture is described through the words “Trust”, “Care” and “Together” which permeate everything we do.
   

  

**Requirements** 
  

  

* >3 years of working with business analysis, requirement analysis, product design or similar.
* Great knowledge in how business needs can be translated into software requirements.
* 
* Great ability to collaborate with product owner(s), architects, system developers and UX designers.
* Communicates fluently in Swedish and English in speech and writing.


**It's a bonus if you**
* Experience of health informatics, and/or integration work (e.g. API design).
* Knowledge of healthcare standards and specifications (FHIR, HL7v2, RIVTA, OpenEHR, SNOMED CT)
* Previously have worked within healthcare, preferably from ICU or AN
* Experience in working with agile software development
* Experience in UX design


**Place of employment** 
 : Stockholm or Linköping
   

  

 At Cambio we value a healthy work-life balance, and to encourage that we apply a hybrid working-model. Together with your team you decide which days you work at the office. On the remaining days you can work remotely from home, but you are always more than welcome to work at the office too.
   

  

**Scope** 
 : Full time
   

  

**Form of employment:** 
 Permanent employment, 6 months trial period
   

  

**Other:** 
 We screen the applications and hold interviews continuously so please send your application as soon as possible via the link.
   

  

 We encourage and eagerly welcome all applications, but we will only consider candidates who are located and have the legal right to work in Sweden
 **.** 
 We will ask for verification during the process.
   

  

**We look forward to receiving your application!**
 Read more about us
 **here!**
 Are you interested in Cambio but you don’t feel that this position is the perfect match? Check out our other open positions at the career site
 **here!**
 Cambio Healthcare Systems is Sweden’s leading suppliers of healthcare information systems and a growing player in the European market with just over 100,000 users across general and university hospitals, specialist units and outpatient units. Through the use of our integrated solutions, our customers provide services to 4 million patients.

title: Product Manager - Underwriting
job_function: Finance, Business Development, and Product Management
description:
We’re a cutting-edge tech enabled bank on a mission to revolutionize financing for small businesses across 7 markets in northern Europe. Our innovative solutions aim to simplify access to financing and enable growth for small businesses. As we scale, we’re looking for a Product Manager to lead the development of our underwriting products and processes, ensuring seamless, data-driven lending experiences tailored to the needs of small business customers while ensuring that our systems are robust, scalable and compliant.
 



  





**About the role** 




 As Product Manager for Underwriting, you will own the strategy, development, and execution of underwriting for small businesses. This role requires a deep understanding of the underwriting processes and the needs of small businesses. You will lead a cross-functional team and collaborate closely with the business teams to deliver efficient, scalable, compliant underwriting products that drive growth and customer satisfaction. As Product Manager for Underwriting, you will report directly to the Chief Operating Officer.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities:** 



* **Product Strategy** 
 : Define and communicate a clear product vision and strategy that aligns with the company’s goals and customer needs.
* **Roadmap Development** 
 : Create and manage a product roadmap, prioritizing features and improvements based on data-driven insights, user feedback, and business impact.
* **Innovation** 
 : Stay ahead of trends in financial services, competitor offerings, and emerging technologies to improve our product suite and maintain our competitive edge.
* **Cross-Functional Collaboration** 
 : Work in a cross functional team with engineers, architects and UX and collaborate with e.g. data science, underwriters and compliance functions to define product requirements, ensure smooth development processes and deliver robust products.
* **Performance Measurement** 
 : Monitor product performance through KPIs and analytics, identifying areas for optimization and growth.
* **Risk Management** 
 : Identify potential risks associated with product development and launch and develop strategies to mitigate risks and address challenges.



  





**Requirements:** 



* **3+ years of proven experience** 
 as a Product Manager, preferably from regulated fintech companies, neobanks or banks. Experience in the area of credit origination is highly meriting
* **Strong understanding of digital banking products** 
 , efficient platforms and credit risk in addition to an understanding of compliance requirements
* **Excellent analytical skills** 
 , with the ability to synthesize data, user feedback, and business goals into actionable product strategies
* **Outstanding communication** 
 and collaboration skills, with experience working in cross-functional teams
* **Proficiency in JIRA** 
 and agile methodologies
* **Fluency in English** 
 , written and spoken
* **Bachelor's or Master’s degree** 
 in Business, Engineering or Computer Science is a plus



  





**Why join us?** 




 This is a unique opportunity to shape and build innovative underwriting solutions in a growing fintech company that is redefining financial services for small businesses in Northern Europe. You’ll work with a passionate and innovative team, helping to create an environment where employees thrive and contribute to a shared vision of success.
 



  





**One last thing** 




 This is a full-time, permanent position based in Stockholm. Don’t wait to send in your application, we are reviewing applications on a rolling basis. While the start date is flexible, the right candidate can join us immediately.
 



  





*Qred celebrates diversity and does not discriminate based on ethnicity, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, disability status, or any other applicable characteristics protected by law.*

title: Front-end Svelte Developer
description:
Are you passionate about building intuitive, fast, and responsive web interfaces?
 **Triform** 
 is looking for a talented
 **Front-end Svelte Developer** 
 to join our team in Stockholm.
 



  
 



**Responsibilities** 



* Develop and maintain highly responsive web applications using
 **Svelte**
* Collaborate with UX/UI designers to implement designs that prioritize user experience
* Optimize performance and ensure that our front-end applications are scalable and maintainable
* Work closely with the back-end team to integrate APIs and ensure seamless data flow
* Participate in code reviews and contribute to team knowledge sharing



  





**Qualifications** 



* Experience with
 **Svelte** 
 or similar front-end frameworks
* Always in the forefront of the latest technology and loves producing excellent solutions
* Experience from an innovative workplace or role and experience in integrating with complex back-end systems
* Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail
* Experience in optimizing front-end performance
* Ability to work in a fast-paced, collaborative environment

title: Senior Product Manager (Bangkok-based)
description:
**About Agoda**
 Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with a global network of 4.7M hotels and holiday properties worldwide, plus flights, activities, and more . Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 7,100+ employees representing 95+ nationalities in 27 markets foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership, enhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.
   

  

**Our Purpose –** 
**Bridging the World Through Travel**
 We believe travel allows people to enjoy, learn and experience more of the amazing world we live in. It brings individuals and cultures closer together, fostering empathy, understanding and happiness.
   

  

 We are a skillful, driven and diverse team from across the globe, united by a passion to make an impact. Harnessing our innovative technologies and strong partnerships, we aim to make travel easy and rewarding for everyone.
   

  

**Get to know our team:**
 In Product, ideas come alive. The world is moving fast so our culture empowers ownership and minimal bureaucracy. That’s the environment that enables you to do what you think is right – and quickly. Our Product Managers move fast, fail, learn, and pivot.
   

  

 Being a product-centric organization, our team works cross-functionally to build products from conception to launch by bringing together engineering and business worlds. Agoda Product Managers work closely with executive leadership and have high visibility among the C-suite; they have direct impact on Agoda’s growth and strategy. Product puts our travelers first and delivers that special travel experience in the most creative expression.
   

  

**The opportunity:**
 This role is
 **BANGKOK-BASED, RELOCATION PROVIDED.** 
 Our Senior Product Managers are analytical and data-driven individuals, who’re responsible for building products end-to-end focusing on analyzing and experimenting until our solutions are perfectly tailored to our travelers. As our next Senior Product Manager, you will drive product strategy and partner closely with senior leadership cross-functionally to define, build, and deliver the best travel solutions.
   

  

 You will get dedicated engineering resources that you, and only you define and allocate. We expect you to have a hands-on mentality and spend considerable time with your SCRUM teams, have enthusiasm to develop engineered processes and technologies and apply innovative solutions to make organizational improvements. Product Managers can modify \*every\* system we have in our company to suit their needs.
   

  

 By applying to this role, you’ll be considered for a role either in User Experience, Marketing, Finance or Supply product vertical. The goal is to match you with the team that best aligns with your interests, competencies, and where you will have the most impact. We’re looking for Senior Product Managers for every part of our business. Our entire Product team sits in Bangkok. This is an Individual Contributor position.
   

  

**In this role, you’ll get to:**
* Analyze the online travel ecosystem, markets, competitive landscape and user requirements
* Conceptualize, launch and optimize products and features, experiment, test their performance and iterate quickly
* Work collaboratively with Engineering, Marketing, Legal and UX teams on cutting-edge technologies
* Develop innovative solutions to some of the world’s difficult problems by collaborating as needed across regions, product areas, and functions


**What you’ll need to succeed:**
* Bachelor’s degree in technical field (i.e. Computer Science, Statistics, Engineering, Mathematics, or similar quantitative discipline)
* Proven ability to leverage analytics and quantitative methods to inform and influence decision-making
* Strong data skills
* Excellent communication skills (both verbal and written in English) with proven ability to convey complex messages clearly and with conviction to different stakeholders
* Experience developing and launching products
* Experience leading global product vision, go-to-market strategy and design discussions
* Entrepreneurial and analytical skills; effective at breaking down complex problems and driving and managing change
* Hands-on mentality


**It’s great if you have:**
* MBA or Master’s degree in Math, Economics, Computer Science or Statistics
* Data tools – SQL, Python, R, or equivalent

title: Sveriges Radio söker en fullstackutvecklare med backend-tyngd
description:
Sveriges Radios uppdrag är att sända radio i allmänhetens tjänst och vi har 7,4 miljoner lyssnare i veckan. Över hälften av befolkningen tar del av vårt utbud i någon form varje dag. Antingen i direktsänd linjär radio eller on-demand, i FM, på våra egna digitala plattformar eller hos andra aktörer. Vi erbjuder trovärdig kunskap, fördjupning, sällskap och förströelse. Att jobba på Sveriges Radio innebär därför att du, oavsett roll, är en värdefull del i ett viktigt uppdrag.
   

  

 Nu bygger vi en ny digital publiceringsplattform. De nya applikationerna i plattformen kommer förse Sveriges Radios digitala kanaler med innehåll. I teamet arbetar du med ett planeringsverktyg för de sändningar som sker i radio samt ett programhanteringsverktyg för att effektivisera vårt redaktionella arbete.
   

  

 Teamet är distribuerat och korsfunktionellt och består av utvecklare, UX och produktägare som jobbar tätt tillsammans med redaktionell personal.
   

  

**Vill du hjälpa oss med tekniska utmaningar i arbetet med att nå miljoner lyssnare?**
 Är du en erfaren fullstack-utvecklare med djup kompetens inom backend? Gillar du att arbeta i ett tvärfunktionellt team som gemensamt lyfter några av våra viktigaste interna produktionsverktyg till nästa nivå? Då är vi gärna dina nya kollegor.
   

  

 Som fullstack-utvecklare på Sveriges Radio befinner du dig i en tekniskt komplicerad miljö och får utveckla de plattformar som gör det möjligt att nå miljontals människor. Du blir en del av ett team som jobbar med continuos delivery, parprogrammering och allt i en modern Microsoft-teknikstack och med både nya och gamla system.
   

  

 För att lyckas i rollen som fullstack-utvecklare i teamet finns du i framkanten av modern .NET och trivs att utveckla med modern arkitektur. Du är van att jobba med relationsdatabaser som till exempel SQL Server/Postgres. Att jobba med moderna frontend-ramverk, t.ex. Vue, är en del av din vardag. Du är bekväm med DevOps och har jobbat med tekniker som CI/CD (Git, Kubernetes, Docker, Octopus). Du räds inte att befinna dig i en “stora system-kontext" och har erfarenhet inom backend-integration. Du får gärna ha du tidigare erfarenhet av Azure Devops och meriterande är om du har jobbat i ett Mediebolag.
   

  

 ,
   

  

**Vill du bidra till Sveriges Radios utveckling med nya perspektiv?**
 Vi letar alltid efter medarbetare som kan få oss att tänka i nya banor, ge oss fler perspektiv och som kan lära oss nya saker. Det innebär att du som utvecklare har stora möjligheter att påverka och du får ett arbete som är utmanande, omväxlande och personligt utvecklande. Vårt mål är att hela tiden bli lite bättre på det vi gör och hur vi gör det.
   

  

**Vi Söker Dig Som**
* är en självgående och prestigelös lagspelare som tar initiativ, vågar både pröva och ompröva såväl arkitektur som techval
* gillar att utbyta kunskap med dina kollegor och utvecklas tillsammans
* har synen att göra fel som ett naturligt sätt att lära och komma framåt.
* har ett djupt rotat, brinnande intresse för tech - såväl på arbetet som på fritiden i olika hobbyprojekt
* trivs med att arbeta med andra och ser relationen till kollegor såväl i som utanför teamet som en nyckel för framgång
* är van att arbeta agilt


**Vad Erbjuder Vi Dig**
 På Sveriges Radio vill vi att du ska få chansen att utvecklas. Vi är generösa med fortbildning, och deltar i både nationella och internationella samarbeten. Eftersom vi är en lärande organisation har vi ett stort utbud av interna högkvalitativa kurser. I vardagen lyfter vi varandra, lär och utvecklas tillsammans genom workshops, mobbprogrammering och demos. Alla medarbetare får friskvårdsbidrag och kan teckna gymkort i Radiohusets fullutrustade gym eller träna på något av alla ledarledda pass. Utifrån teamets behov varvar vi arbete på plats med distansarbete. Vi ser bara fördelar med allas våra olikheter och är stolta över att vi jobbar på en arbetsplats där alla har chans att göra skillnad.
   

  

**Anställning**
 Tillsvidareanställning med inledande 6 månaders provanställning och tillträde enligt överenskommelse.
   

  

*Sveriges Radio är en del av Sveriges kritiska infrastruktur och har en viktig roll inom totalförsvaret. Vår verksamhet omfattas bland annat av regler om säkerhetsskydd och på grund av det genomförs en kontroll av kandidaten för många av tjänsterna i vår verksamhet innan anställning sker. För de tjänster som leder till deltagande i säkerhetskänslig verksamhet eller placering i säkerhetsklass innebär denna kontroll att säkerhetsprövning genomförs i enlighet med säkerhetsskyddslagen.*
**Ansökan och kontaktuppgifter**
 Tjänsten som fullstackutvecklare är en tillsvidareanställning med placering i Stockholm eller Eskilstuna. Vi hanterar ansökningarna löpande, så vänta inte med att skicka in din ansökan.
   

  

**Vill du veta mer?** 
 Kontakta Sofia Lybeck, på sofia.lybeck@sr.se
   

  

 Fackliga frågor besvaras av Unionen, Saco och Journalistförbundet, samtliga nås genom växeln på 08-7845000
   

  

**Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!**

title: Senior Quantitative User Experience Researcher (Frontend) (Bangkok-based, Relocation provided)
description:
**About Agoda**
 Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with a global network of 4.7M hotels and holiday properties worldwide, plus flights, activities, and more . Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 7,100+ employees representing 95+ nationalities in 27 markets foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership, enhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.
   

  

**Our Purpose –** 
**Bridging the World Through Travel**
 We believe travel allows people to enjoy, learn and experience more of the amazing world we live in. It brings individuals and cultures closer together, fostering empathy, understanding and happiness.
   

  

 We are a skillful, driven and diverse team from across the globe, united by a passion to make an impact. Harnessing our innovative technologies and strong partnerships, we aim to make travel easy and rewarding for everyone.
   

  

**We have only scratched the surface.** 
 The online travel industry is an extremely dynamic and competitive space. We aim to deliver compelling designs that create a world-class customer experience. You will have a key role in defining the future of our products that reach millions of customers. Despite our size, we operate in a startup-like environment.
   

  

**Work in the heart of Asia.** 
 This is an amazing opportunity if you’re looking for an exciting adventure abroad while expanding your international research capabilities. You get a chance to live in one of the most beautiful and most visited cities in the world!
   

  

**This position is open to worldwide candidates and we will assist you with a generous relocation package, ensuring a smooth transition to working and living in Bangkok.**
 Senior UX Researchers have the breadth and depth of research method skills applicable to a wide range of questions, and over time develop standout areas of research excellence. A long track record and documented success in both research itself and achieving organizational impact is characteristic of Senior UX Researchers. The ability to integrate research into the work of colleagues in other roles makes the Senior UX Researcher effective and helps him/her achieve out-sized impact from research efforts. This ability, along with others that turn research into a strategic asset for Agoda’s decisions and processes, comes from a maturity in overall research approach emphasizing the highest benefit from all research investments.
   

  

**Qualifications:**
* Masters Degree or PhD or equivalent experience in Computer Science, Human-Computer Interaction, Information Science, Psychology, Social Science, or any related field
* 10+ years of relevant experience in consumer-facing business domains.
* Expert in Quantitative research. (Log analysis, internal metrics triangulation, survey design, response effects, sampling, crosstabs, and statistical concepts, etc.)
* But, also has experience with Qualitative and user-centered design methods (individual and group interviews, diary studies, direct observation, think-aloud usability testing, etc.)
* Comfortable with planning, scoping, conducting, analyzing and communicating research.
* Experience in evaluating, negotiating, and working with external research vendors.
* Be able to describe user problems and business opportunities to a variety of stakeholders by leveraging both quantitative and qualitative data.
* Ability to demonstrate critical thinking beyond business requests
* Is a great storyteller and communicator, able to speak fluently to business people, product teams, designers, engineers, and other stakeholders. (in English)
* Enjoys collaborative work in a dynamic, data-driven, and creative environment.


**Responsibilities:**
 General Role Expectations:
   

  

* Conducts research end-to-end for high impact, leading stakeholders to the best collaboration with research for their goals
* Initiates research efforts serving Product Vertical goals in the medium- and long-term given a well-informed understanding of the business
* Formulates programmes of study and cumulative knowledge sharing relevant to the strategic objectives of their teams
* Leads projects that are collaborations with other stakeholders
* Accounts for the pros and cons of various research methodologies, and mentors others the use of techniques and tools for high-quality execution


 Research Skills:
   

  

* Expertise at evaluating research opportunities, particularly with ambiguous requests e.g. importance, urgency, and impact
* Ability to manage, challenge and shape inbound research requests, and propose solid research projects or programs
* Excellent project execution, while exploring alternate methods, mixed methods and innovative approaches
* Deep understands of the pros and cons of quantitative and qualitative research – and use of this knowledge to direct projects to appropriate methods
* Deep expertise in at least one domain (eg. Pricing), a user type (eg. Business traveler) or a method (eg. Diary Study), being the “go-to person” on the research team for this
* Triangulation of findings, methods, and theories within a project to ensure reliability and depth of insight
* Ability to maximize the value and efficiency of research by applying secondary research and expert inspection methods
* Solid knowledge of various software tools common in the field (e.g. for surveys, diary studies, analysis), and ability to apply the right tool to the problem
* Solid knowledge of GDPR, data compliance and ethics that is present in all of their activities


 Communication & Collaboration:
   

  

* Drives cross discipline/department collaboration via research insights/activities
* Collaborates efficiently with other researchers and other disciplines with clear commitment to shared ownership
* Shows excellent communication skills; tailored communication style for different audiences, concise and to the point, open to take input and feedback
* Contributes to the communication and implementation of agreed standards of research excellence across the organization
